channel.title: Problem loading CFG's Unix (VPS)
channel.description:
I have a VPS, it's more then capable of running a private server has enough ram, Java etc... My problem is the loading of the server when I receive the following error on start up.
prince@WhiteHouse [/home/prince/SSH/ChaosScape]# ./run.sh prince@WhiteHouse [/home/prince/SSH/ChaosScape]# ChaosScape Server - Version # 121 Loading 7 files... Invalid arguments! Usage: [port-offset] prince@WhiteHouse [/home/prince/SSH/ChaosScape]#
By startup bash script is:
#!/bin/bash java -Xms170M -Xmx200M server &
On windows where it runs perfectley without error on startup it loads the 7 .cfg files these files contain information such as spawns, objects, npcs etc.. I wanted to investigate the matter further so I tested my theory on the source Devolution v7 I used the same command to start the server and the server started but was unable to load the cfg files. So the question is what would be causing this problem? [br][br][size=1]Posted on: 05 September 2009, 18:13:46[/size][hr]Anyone??

item.title: Problem loading CFG's Unix (VPS)
item.dc:creator: @EwfsPrince EwfsPrince
item.description:
@EwfsPrince wrote:

I have a VPS, it’s more then capable of running a private server has enough ram, Java etc…
My problem is the loading of the server when I receive the following error on start up.

prince@WhiteHouse [/home/prince/SSH/ChaosScape]# ./run.sh prince@WhiteHouse [/home/prince/SSH/ChaosScape]# ChaosScape Server - Version # 121 Loading 7 files... Invalid arguments! Usage: [port-offset]

prince@WhiteHouse [/home/prince/SSH/ChaosScape]#

By startup bash script is:

#!/bin/bash java -Xms170M -Xmx200M server &

On windows where it runs perfectley without error on startup it loads the 7 .cfg files these files contain information such as spawns, objects, npcs etc…
I wanted to investigate the matter further so I tested my theory on the source Devolution v7 I used the same command to start the server and the server started but was unable to load the cfg files.

So the question is what would be causing this problem?

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 05 September 2009, 18:13:46[/size][hr]Anyone??
